description: An unitended consequence of convalescent serum is the transfer of other pathogens such as HIV and hepatitis C from the survivors' blood to the Ebola patient. To deter this, we could mandate a screening of survivors before they donate blood. A simple blood test could inform us of any agents that would harm someone. If a screening comes back clean, we take their blood for use in infected patients. If any dangerous substances are detected, we simply send the survivor on their way. Doing this, we could prevent the possible spread of harmful pathogens in our attempt to supply the survivors' antibodies to the infected patient.
summary: The use of convalescent serum could be a preemptive way to treat Ebola until more advanced options are developed.
title: "WHO ponders treating Ebola-infected people with blood of survivors"
